channel.title: How the #$%& can i portforward?
channel.description:
I have seen all tutorials on portforwarding yet...none have succeeded I'm always having to put my ip adress into the adress bar and it doesnt do sh*t but brind me to an unvalid page ive tried doing "ipconfig" on the command prmtp and ive tried 3 different sites with my ip adress yet to no prevail now im gonna need a way to skip that part and still be able to put my servers online ive coded 1 ive used 2 other than mine
Ive never had a host but i hope they can do this for me i would never pay for a rsps so i wont pay for a hoster sorry

item.title: How the #$%& can i portforward?

i do not have ipv4 adress
i have:

Subnet mask
Defult gateway

also when i type the number into the adress bar it goes to an invalid page
my computer is like windows 2000 but its the first computer to come out with windows xp
made by the g&h company which is old so id say nothing will work

im at BELKIN wireless utility router
it didnt ask for my password/user

Read full topic

item.title: How the #$%& can i portforward?
item.dc:creator: @Untrimmed Untrimmed
item.description:
@Untrimmed wrote:

I would suggest the following:

[ul][li]www.portforward.com[/li]
[li]This tutorial : http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,383567.0.html [/li]
[li]Search bar… [/li][/ul]

OR this quick guide I typed up.
First go into command prompt and type in ipconfig, then scroll up a bit until you find your Ipv4 address, it should be something like 192.168.1.* The * is a number, different for everyone. Now type that in on the address bar and it should ask you for a password for your router. Fill that in and continue. Now go to portforward.com and find your router at the bottom of the page. (Each router is different so I can’t help you in detail here.) Then when you have selected your router it should take you to another page. Scroll down and find “Runescape private server”. Then it will give you a step by step process of how to portforward for your router.

Read full topic
